{{Template:Dialogue a-b-a-b|Grenn|We just cower in here while they slaughter our brothers?|Edd|Our brother had orders to stay at Castle Black.|Oh, so it's alright, then?! Black Jack and Kegs and Mully chopped to pieces because they broke the rules?!|I didn't say it was alright! I'm saying they shouldn't have been there.|[[Grenn]] and [[Eddison Tollett]]|The Mountain and the Viper}}'''Jack Bulwer''', nicknamed '''Black Jack Bulwer''', is a minor character in the [[Season 4|fourth season]]. He is a [[Ranger]] of the [[Night's Watch]]. He is originally from [[House Bulwer]] of [[Blackcrown]]. He is played by guest star [[Cormac McDonagh]] and only appears in "[[The Mountain and the Viper]]".
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Black Jack Bulwer is not killed in a wildling attack on Mole's Town. He gets killed while on a mission, but it happens much later in the books.
sections.Biography:
===[[Season 4]]===
Along with [[Kegs]] and [[Mully]], he travels to the [[Prostitution|brothel]] in [[Mole's Town]]. They sit drinking and listening to a [[Mole's Town whore|whore]] belching out the melodies to popular songs. Jack correctly guesses that she is belching "[[The Bear and the Maiden Fair (song)|The Bear and the Maiden Fair]]". She compliments him on his hearing, but quips that it is a shame that he has a hangnail for a penis. They are later slaughtered when a group of [[Free Folk|wildlings]] led by [[Tormund]] and [[Styr]] [[Sack of Mole's Town|attack]] the village. News of their deaths soon reaches [[Castle Black]].<ref>"[[The Mountain and the Viper]]"</ref>
